isis.stitle: NEWAY AD-123/246 DRIVE AXLE AIR SUSPENSIONS - ADJUSTMENT

svcproc.title: AIR SPRING HEIGHT
svcproc.para: Prior to adjustment, the vehicle must be unloaded.

step1.para: Remove cotter pin and washer from upper link. Loosen the clamp and detach the vertical linkage from the height control lever arm.

Verify that the center punch mark at the leveling valve capscrew is positioned toward the vertical linkage ( Figure 12) and that both clamps are on the inside locations (bolt head end toward the center of vertical rod) of the rubber links.
Build and maintain air pressure in excess of 65 psi. Check all air fittings and valve for leaks. Repair as required.
Check the height adjustment by measuring air spring height ( Figure 13).

Raise height control valve lever approximately 45 degrees above horizontal. Air pressure at the air springs should begin to increase within 15 seconds which will cause the truck frame to rise. This can easily be detected by feeling the shock absorber extend at the dust tube to shock absorber body joint.

Lower height control valve lever approximately 45 degrees below horizontal. Air pressure at the air springs should begin to decrease. Let air escape until air spring height is approximately 10 inches (254mm).
Raise valve lever to 45 degrees above horizontal again, until air spring height is to dimension shown in RIDE HEIGHT CAPACITY CHART. Return lever to horizontal position.

important.para: Always check and set proper air spring height by adding air to the system.

step1.para: Install two centering pins (use two No. 21, or 5/32 inch drill bits) in the valve body to maintain the lever arm in the centered position (horizontal) while installing and adjusting the vertical link to the lever arm.

Lengthen or shorten the vertical linkage such that the rubber links can be slipped over the lever arm and lower anchor. The vertical linkage will slide through the upper and lower rubber links. Be sure the vertical linkage is flush with the top of the upper rubber link. Tighten the upper clamp screws.
Pressurize the air system with a constant supply of air in excess of 65 psi. All air springs should inflate and be at proper air spring height. Inspect air system and eliminate any air leaks.

note.para: If proper air spring height is not obtained, or air springs do not inflate properly, check air pressure, check for proper piping and repeat above steps.
